intro: Coccoloba guianensis var. major, commonly known as the Giant Coccoloba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela, Guyana, and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical rainforests. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife.
